abstracts.cdata!:
This is a Project Completion Report
            (PAR) on the Second Phase of the Seme Oil Field Development
            Project for the Benin. The project in itself was successful.
            Government's losses incurred during first phase were
            partially palliated, during the Bank-financed second phase,
            through both: (a) an increase in oil production through the
            addition of five producing wells; and (b) an increase in its
            share from oil production revenues through the new financing
            agreement with first phase lenders. Profit of the second
            phase was made possible partly because most of the costly
            production installations and facilities had been financed
            under first phase. In a similar process, any further
            development efforts, consisting of putting in production new
            reservoirs, will increase oil production significantly at
            low cost. The association and the European investment bank
            undertook to finance this second phase of development. The
            main components of the credit consisted of: (a) drilling of
            seven wells; and (b) improvement of production facilities.
